Dining Operations Rock & Brews names Michael Sullivan president and CEO Rock & Brews names Michael Sullivan president and CEO Rock & Brews names Michael Sullivan president and CEO Former Buffalo Wild Wings executive and industry veteran to lead chain’s expansion Jonathan Maze , Editor in Chief , Restaurant Business January 24, 2017 2 Min Read Rock & Brews, the restaurant and entertainment concept co-founded by members of the rock band KISS, has named Michael Sullivan president and CEO, the company said Tuesday. Sullivan, a 25-year industry veteran, will be tasked with continuing the 19-unit chain’s expansion. Rock & Brews president and CEO Michael Sullivan Photo: Rock & Brews “Sully’s experience as a multi-brand franchisee and restaurant owner and partner, combined with his success as part of the team responsible for the meteoric growth at Buffalo Wild Wings, made him a natural choice to spearhead the next phase of Rock & Brews’ expansion,” said Michael Zislis, Rock & Brews managing partner and co-founder, in a statement. Rock & Brews named Mike Reynolds CEO in 2014, but he left to become chief development officer at Mrs. Winner’s Chicken & Biscuits last April. Zislis had been acting as interim CEO since Reynolds’ departure. Sullivan has been in the restaurant business for more than 25 years, starting when he bussed tables at Aurelios Pizza at 15 years old, and continuing to when he was 22 years old and bought his first Subway location. In 2003, he went to work for Buffalo Wild Wings and helped the chain grow from 150 locations to more than 1,200 units. In 2012, he was named emerging brands director, and was tasked with acquiring concepts and integrating them into the company. Sullivan met Rock & Brews principals at an industry conference, and then visited several locations. “I was so impressed with the brand, the passion of its founding partners and its potential that I not only accepted the role of president and CEO, I personally invested in the brand,” Sullivan said in a statement. “Rock & Brews is a dynamic, one-of-a-kind experience. It’s simply cool, and I look forward to being part of its growth.” Zislis said: “He is well versed in all aspects of franchise operations and restaurant expansion. He has a keen eye for identifying top-notch, multi-unit franchisees, and we have confidence that his leadership will play an important role as Rock & Brews continues its strategic expansion and diversification.” KISS co-founders Paul Stanley and Gene Simmons, along with Zislis and concert industry veterans Dave Furano and Dell Furano, opened Rock & Brews in El Segundo, Calif., in 2012. The first location booked $10 million in sales a year. The chain has a rock-and-roll, family-friendly theme with locations in the U.S. and Mexico. Contact Jonathan Maze at [email protected] Follow him on Twitter: @jonathanmaze About the Author Jonathan Maze Editor in Chief, Restaurant Business See more from Jonathan Maze Subscribe Nation's Restaurant News Newsletters Get the latest breaking news in the industry, analysis, research, recipes, consumer trends, the latest products and more. Bark & Brew - Leader Dogs for the Blind Skip to content menu Apply Orientation & Mobility Guide Dog Teen Orientation and Mobility Teen Summer Camp Donate Give Once Give Monthly Sponsor A Puppy Contact Us Search MENU Home About Meet Leader Dog Who We Are The Leader Dog Difference Leadership Team Board Members Financial Reports The Leader Dogs for the Blind Foundation Careers Our Impact Campus Facilities and Grounds Polk Residence & Training Center Canine Development Center Downtown Training Center Tours Visiting Service Dogs Events Newsletters Media Client Programs Orientation & Mobility Guide Dog Teen Orientation and Mobility Teen Summer Camp Current Clients & Graduates Volunteer Raise A Puppy Volunteer On Campus Host A Breeding Dog Ways To Give Giving Options Plan My Gift Wills and Living Trusts Donor-Advised Funds Foundation Giving Fundraise Corporate Sponsors Lions Clubs Lions and Leader Dog History Lions Club Resources Resources Be an Ambassador People Who Are Blind Professionals in Blindness Request a Speaker Virtual Learning Collaboration Events Taking the Lead Podcast Alumni Board Home » Bark & Brew Bark & Brew 5K Presented by Chief Financial Credit Union Sunday, June 8, 2025 Join us for the Bark & Brew 5K, proudly presented by Chief Financial Credit Union! Celebrate the start of summer with a scenic walk/run through the heart of Downtown Rochester, MI. All proceeds from this event support Leader Dog’s free programs and services for individuals who are blind or low vision. Don’t miss out on this exciting event – register today! The race begins at 9 a.m. Race participants receive a race t-shirt, large medal, race bib and a coupon for a free, age-appropriate beverage and food item at the post-race party. New in 2025! V.I.PAW – As a VIP, you will receive a 2025 branded Bark & Brew 5K pint glass, dog bandana, along with your race bib, shirt, medal and post-race beverage/food item. This category is capped at 500 registrants, so don't wait to register! New Course – The 2025 5K course will guide runners through Downtown Rochester, leading into Rochester Municipal Park along Paint Creek. Participants will then transition onto the Paint Creek Trail, passing the Rochester Library and crossing University Drive before reaching the finish line near the Rochester Mills Beer Company. Post-Race Party – After the race, celebrate your achievement with a complimentary beverage from Rochester Mills Beer Company and a slice of pizza, or opt for a Starbucks coffee and a Knapp's donut. No matter your choice, enjoy the moment while soaking in the amazing sounds of local musicians. After completing your race, head over to the Bark & Brew event site at Rochester Mills Beer Company to redeem your free beverage coupon! Have your non-running friends and family join you at the Bark & Brew event and continue the fun throughout the morning. Register Now Additional event details can be found on the Bark and Brew 2025 FAQ page . For event info and to sponsor Bark & Brew, contact: Email: Stephen Moran Special Events Manager Phone: 248-659-5046 Interested in becoming a sponsor for Bark and Brew? View the Leader Dog single event sponsorship form . Bark Bar Now Under New Ownership Art & Entertainment Museums Music Shopping Sports Weekend Events Food & Drink Cocktail Recipes Bucket Lists Face Behind the Place Recipes Restaurants Server Says Health Health Care Mental Health Guide Arkansas Mental Health Guide Archive Home/Garden Design & Bloom Featured Homes Home Resources Interior Design(ers) Murder Mystery People Ask an Expert Faces of Arkansas Get to Know AY's Best Heather's Favorite Things Local Luminary People Behind Your News Travel Arkansas Backstories Places to Stay Spring Travel Guide Travel Guide Contests & Nominations Nominate AY's Best Women in Health Care 2025 Nominate Arkansas Insurance Agents Nominate AY's Intriguing Women More Sponsored Posts Submit Event / Press Release / Info Subscribe to AY Print Magazine Subscribe to AY's newsletter Where to find AY About Us Custom Publications Digital Issues Archive Arkansas Mental Health Guide Archive Intriguing Women 2024 Men of Distinction 2024 Intriguing Women 2023 Men of Distinction 2023 Intriguing Women 2022 Men of Distinction 2022 Intriguing Women 2021 Men Of Distinction 2021 Intriguing Women 2020 Intriguing Women 2019 Intriguing Women 2018 Bark Bar Now Under New Ownership Posted by AY Staff | Sep 15, 2023 | Latest News from AY , People | 0 | After six successful years of serving as the heart of the “Barkansas” dog-loving community, the award-winning Bark Bar has been officially sold to William Doxey, a dynamic entrepreneur known for Puppy Community, regularly seen at Little Rock-area farmers’ markets. The transaction, completed by the previous owners and co-founders, Elizabeth Michael and Daniel Roda, marks an exciting new chapter for the beloved canine haven. Michael and Roda have announced this transfer of ownership as they look to focus on their other business ventures and growing family. Elizabeth Michael – Photo by Jamison Mosley Michael is the owner of Marian , a marketing consultancy firm specializing in social media marketing, public relations, and marketing automation. She has won numerous industry awards and is a member of the prestigious Meta Leader’s Network. She’s also a partner in the cannabis ad agency, Bud Agency , and contributes her expertise as the part-time executive director of the nonprofit organization SoMa Little Rock, Inc . Roda is an entrepreneur, attorney and real estate developer, having been part of the development team on large-scale historic rehabilitation projects including the AC Hotel by Marriott Little Rock and the Home2 Suites by Hilton St. Louis. In November of 2022, Roda successfully sold the financial technology company he co-founded, Abaca, to Safe Harbor Financial , where he now serves as the executive vice president and chief operating officer. A few weeks later, the Michael-Roda family welcomed their first child, Paul Michael Roda. “I’m incredibly proud of the journey Bark Bar has undertaken over the past six years,” Elizabeth Michael shared. “However, with our current workload and growing family, the time felt right to entrust Bark Bar to capable hands. William’s energy and vision, along with Allie Lindley’s leadership as the general manager, assures me that Bark Bar will continue to be ‘pawesome.’” William Doxey – Photo by Bernice Garden William Doxey, previously in technology product management, has more recently become the proprietor of the beloved local brand Puppy Community, a pop-up and online dog gear and treat retailer. Acquiring Bark Bar presents an exciting opportunity for Doxey, enabling him to establish a retail brick-and-mortar presence and further expand his brand. “I’m eager to build upon the fantastic foundation that the Bark Bar established,” said Doxey. “I’m thrilled to collaborate with Allie and the dedicated staff, as well as engage with the vibrant Bark Bar regulars (and their humans). Our collective efforts will bring new dimensions to this cherished establishment, including expanding the kitchen, upgrading the outdoor play yard and giving the interior space a fresh makeover.” Under the new ownership, Bark Bar is set to embark on a journey of growth and enhancement, continuing its reputation as a community hub for dogs and their people. Greg Henderson of Rock City Commercial represented the buyer and sellers in this transaction.
